page.title: 06SWINDERBY SUNDAY SCHOOL.
page.content: The Village Sunday School is jointly run by the {Anglicans }and {Methodists for 3 to 12 year olds. It meets at 10.15 at the Methodist Church. They sing hymns from the BBC book {"Come And Praise",}pray, listen to a Bible story and may draw a picture, act a play or make a collage. In July 1985 25 children took part in the{Sunday School Anniversary.} The theme was Caring and Sharing, they had written the service including plays about Jesus and stories of Live Aid for Ethiopia, Mother Teresa and the National Childrens Home. Afterwards everyone had tea together. The children may attend family and {special services}for Advent,Christmas, Mothering Sunday,Easter and Harvest at either Church. The 1984 Carol Service at the Methodist Church included a play by the children.
